content:
• Tuesday, October 2, 2012
  • ITMN

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN) +5.7% AH after announcing Canada's national health service has approved...

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN) +5.7% AH after announcing Canada's national health service has approved its Esbriet pulmonary fibrosis drug - the company expects sales to begin on Jan. 1. Esbriet has already been approved for use in Japan, South Korea, and 29 European countries, but FDA approval is still pending the outcome of clinical trials. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 PM
  • SVU

    Billionaire Ronald Burkle and P-E firms KKR and TPG are interested in Supervalu (NYSE:SVU),...

    Billionaire Ronald Burkle and P-E firms KKR and TPG are interested in Supervalu (NYSE:SVU), Bloomberg reports, but are only thinking of buying parts of the hard-luck grocery chain rather than the whole. Supervalu still wants someone to buy the company in full (previous), and is said to have extended its offer deadline beyond a prior Oct. 15. One source claims Supervalu's struggles have "stalled progress on any kind of offer." Shares +2.6% AH. (store closings)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM
  • NTAP

    More on Xyratex's FQ3: Revenue was in-line with the guidance Xyratex provided in its September...

    More on Xyratex's FQ3: Revenue was in-line with the guidance Xyratex provided in its September warning. But FQ4 revenue is expected to be within a range of $235M-$285M and EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.43, well below an outdated consensus of $327.9M and $0.49. In addition to noting the qualification delays partly behind its FQ3 warning, Xyratex claims "industry dynamics are weaker than what was expected a few months ago" - possibly bad news for customers NTAP, STX, and WDC. XRTX -11.5% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • SPN

    Superior Energy Services (NYSE:SPN) -3.2% AH after issuing downside guidance for Q3, citing...

    Superior Energy Services (NYSE:SPN) -3.2% AH after issuing downside guidance for Q3, citing Hurricane Isaac's impact on Gulf of Mexico operations, a more rapid decline in the onshore U.S. rig count than anticipated, and unexpected delays in delivering an Arctic-specific spill containment system to a customer in Alaska.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ3 EPS of $0.37 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $275.7M (-24% Y/Y) misses by...

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ3 EPS of $0.37 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $275.7M (-24% Y/Y) misses by $43M. Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • SKX

    Believing European sales "are running below plan," Susquehanna cuts its H2 estimates on Skechers...

    Believing European sales "are running below plan," Susquehanna cuts its H2 estimates on Skechers USA (SKX -12.7%) and trims a dollar off its price target, noting that "boys' and men's have been sluggish to return to growth in the U.S." While the firm thinks earnings will "grow significantly" next year, it questions how meaningful the acceleration could be.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CMO

    A happy ending looks to be in store for Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) investors today, as the...

    A happy ending looks to be in store for Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) investors today, as the stock moves into positive territory after earlier tumbling 7.5% in minutes for no apparent reason.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 4 Comments
  • CVE

    An agreement by Cenovus Energy (CVE +2%) to purchase the remaining assets of Oilsands Quest for...

    An agreement by Cenovus Energy (CVE +2%) to purchase the remaining assets of Oilsands Quest for $10M receives approval from the Alberta Court of Queens Bench. Most of the assets are located adjacent to CVE's proposed Telephone Lake oil sands project in Alberta province.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • SQM

    Chemical & Mining Co. (SQM -1.6%) of Chile loses its 20-year concession to produce...

    Chemical & Mining Co. (SQM -1.6%) of Chile loses its 20-year concession to produce lithium awarded recently through a public tender from the Chilean government, which invalidated the tender process after accepting a claim from a competitor that SQM didn't follow the rules.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • FSLR

    Sumitomo says it is purchasing a 25% stake in First Solar's (FSLR +3.9%) Desert Sunlight Solar...

    Sumitomo says it is purchasing a 25% stake in First Solar's (FSLR +3.9%) Desert Sunlight Solar Farm project, the Japanese trading house's first investment in a U.S. solar farm. Desert Sunlight has secured power purchase agreements to supply SoCal Edison with 250MW and Pacific Gas & Electric with 300MW of clean energy for the next two decades.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • BIDU

    The Street seems to enjoy criticizing Baidu (BIDU -0.9%) these days almost as much as it enjoys...

    The Street seems to enjoy criticizing Baidu (BIDU -0.9%) these days almost as much as it enjoys praising Apple. A day after Jefferies downgraded Baidu, Raymond James is doing the same, though its rating merely goes to Outperform from Strong Buy. RJ points to Hitwise data that shows Baidu had 58.3% of the Chinese search market as of mid-September, down from the low-to-mid 60s before Qihoo's (QIHU +5%) arrival. Qihoo's share is pegged at 9.2%. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • FWONA

    The FCC announces that any parties that oppose Liberty Media's (LMCA +0.7%) proposal to take...

    The FCC announces that any parties that oppose Liberty Media's (LMCA +0.7%) proposal to take over Sirius Radio XM (SIRI +2.7%) have until November 1st to file their initial protest with the agency. With the merger now all but imminent, shares of SIRI have ripped to a 4-year high today, helped in part by BofA's Jessica Reif Cohen who launched coverage with a Buy rating on the "compelling" stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • DAEG

    Midday top 10 gainers: DAEG +18%. PCS +18%. ULTR +16%. KFS +16%. CTIC +16%. UQM +13%. LEAP +13%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: DAEG +18%. PCS +18%. ULTR +16%. KFS +16%. CTIC +16%. UQM +13%. LEAP +13%. DYSL +13%. IMH +13%. SANW +10%.
    Top 10 Losers: PBM -66%. ARQL -54%. MSCI -29%. EXPR -21%. OTC:AMCF -18%. CLB -16%. CHC -14%. SKX -11%. CUR -10%. DSTI -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MSCI

    MSCI Inc. (MSCI -29%) plunges in wake of Vanguard deciding to swap out of using the company's...

    MSCI Inc. (MSCI -29%) plunges in wake of Vanguard deciding to swap out of using the company's indexes as benchmarks for 22 of its ETFs. "We are disappointed," says MSCI's Index Business chief in the understatement of the day. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (Z -4.4%) claims it responded to the concerns raised in the SEC's Aug. 30 letter to the...

    Zillow (Z -4.4%) claims it responded to the concerns raised in the SEC's Aug. 30 letter to the agency's satisfaction, according to an e-mail cited by Bloomberg. The real estate site filed a response to the letter on Aug. 31, promising to improve its disclosure of some data requested by the SEC, while stating the disclosure of other requested data isn't possible.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMO

    Flash crash in Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO)? The typically slow-moving mortgage REIT plunges...

    Flash crash in Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO)? The typically slow-moving mortgage REIT plunges about 7.5% in minutes on no particular news (no, it was not "Einhorned"). The stock has since recovered much of the loss, now -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • DKS

    Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +3.7%) and Lululemon (LULU +2.8%) trade higher after David Einhorn...

    Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +3.7%) and Lululemon (LULU +2.8%) trade higher after David Einhorn omits the companies from his list of targets in front of the Value Investing Congress. Despite avoiding the blowback from an Einhorn swipe, both names are still on the high end of the list of heavily shorted stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • GMCR

    Though David Einhorn took aim at Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +1.5%), Starbucks (SBUX -1.7%) sold...

    Though David Einhorn took aim at Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +1.5%), Starbucks (SBUX -1.7%) sold off as Einhorn expressed concerns about the coffee chain's K-Cup distribution deal with Green Mountain. Green Mountain, meanwhile, has turned positive - 34.6% of the company's float was shorted as of Sep. 14, and some of those shorts probably expected some harsh remarks from Einhorn, given his past opinions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 6 Comments
  • GEL

    Midstream energy-service company Genesis Energy (GEL -4.1%) trades lower after pricing its...

    Midstream energy-service company Genesis Energy (GEL -4.1%) trades lower after pricing its 6M-unit offering at $32.15, a 6.9% discount to Monday's close. The company says the offering represented limited partner interests held by Quintana Capital Group, as well as various other sellers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • SDT

    SandRidge Mississippian Trust I (SDT -4.2%) trades lower after parent company SandRidge...

    SandRidge Mississippian Trust I (SDT -4.2%) trades lower after parent company SandRidge (NYSE:SD) disclosed a large sale in an SEC filing out just before the open of 668K shares at $22.98 each. The timing of the filing suggests the trade occurred before market hours in a private transaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • EQU

    Equal Energy (EQU +1.4%) announces the sale of its Halkirk, Alliance, Wainwright and Clair...

    Equal Energy (EQU +1.4%) announces the sale of its Halkirk, Alliance, Wainwright and Clair assets and substantially all remaining non-producing Canadian assets for $17.4M. EQU says the asset disposition is the second step in the company's ongoing strategic review process.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • COG

    Methane in two Pennsylvania water wells reportedly has a chemical fingerprint that links it to...

    Methane in two Pennsylvania water wells reportedly has a chemical fingerprint that links it to natural gas from the Marcellus Shale drilled by Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -1.9%) through fracking, evidence that such drilling can pollute drinking water. COG maintains its operations haven’t contaminated the wells, and its scientists say the gas isn’t from the Marcellus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 7 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home (KBH +1%) suffers only a brief dip before recovering with the general market this...

    KB Home (KBH +1%) suffers only a brief dip before recovering with the general market this morning, following a downgrade to Sell by Citigroup on valuation. Citi says the company is over-leveraged relative to its peers, and will likely need to raise capital to reduce its interest drag and scale up inventory. Separately, it ups Lennar (LEN +0.8%) to Neutral from sell, citing cautious optimism over a bump in housing starts.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    David Einhorn, who giveth new life (General Motors) and taketh away (Green Mountain Coffee...

    David Einhorn, who giveth new life (General Motors) and taketh away (Green Mountain Coffee Roasters), now has Chipotle (CMG -6.5%) in his sights. His short thesis on the "nosebleed" valuation name focuses on Taco Bell and its updated Cantina Bell menu - despite previous reports tipping off that the effect has been minimal. Naturally, shares of Chipotle are diving off the Einhorn takedown.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 11 Comments
  • MOS

    Ag stocks are sinking after Mosaic's (MOS -4.6%) weaker than expected results and conference...

    Ag stocks are sinking after Mosaic's (MOS -4.6%) weaker than expected results and conference call comments that fertilizer prices haven't risen in tandem with grain prices due to a weaker macro environment and greater supply uncertainty. Potash shipments are expected to decline in 2012 vs. 2011 before rebounding in 2013. POT -2.9%, CF -1.7%, AGU -0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • GM

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) gets a 2% boost as David Einhorn calls it an "ugly duckling" that has a...

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) gets a 2% boost as David Einhorn calls it an "ugly duckling" that has a cheap valuation and has seriously cut costs. Earlier, GM reported a 1.5% boost to sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -0.9%) reverberate as David Einhorn's...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -0.9%) reverberate as David Einhorn's presentation hits its stride at the Value Investing Congress. Not surprisingly, Einhorn's take is still negative as he points out that the company's capex spending looks excessive and that Starbucks appears to be backing off its partnership. Has the short play run its course? Einhorn: "We think there is still significant downside from here."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 6 Comments
  • TMUS

    More on Deutsche Telekom/MetroPCS: Bloomberg claims DT's board is set to meet tomorrow to...

    More on Deutsche Telekom/MetroPCS: Bloomberg claims DT's board is set to meet tomorrow to approve the acquisition, and that an announcement could arrive the same day. David Faber reports the purchase will be an all-stock deal. MetroPCS (PCS +18.7%) has added to its gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CEI

    Lucas Energy (LEI +7.9%) strikes a JV with a U.S. player backed by Chinese investors to pump...

    Lucas Energy (LEI +7.9%) strikes a JV with a U.S. player backed by Chinese investors to pump $100M into exploitation of Texas oil assets. Milestone Energy agrees to fund 80% of the cost of the properties to be developed in the Austin Chalk and Eagle Ford trends, as well as all drilling and completion expenses plus project generation fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • ACOR

    Shares of Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +3.7%) gain on heavy volume this morning following S&P's...

    Shares of Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +3.7%) gain on heavy volume this morning following S&P's announcement late yesterday that it would be added to the S&P SmallCap 600 index.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • ON

    ON Semi (ONNN +2.2%) and Microchip (MCHP +1.1%) trade higher after receiving upgrades to Buy...

    ON Semi (ONNN +2.2%) and Microchip (MCHP +1.1%) trade higher after receiving upgrades to Buy from ThinkEquity. The firm predicts new ON Semi CFO Bernard Gutmann will improve profitability, and that Microchip's recent acquisitions will boost earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • SYNA

    A day after tumbling on a downgrade from Pac Crest, Synaptics (SYNA +4.2%) is rallying thanks to...

    A day after tumbling on a downgrade from Pac Crest, Synaptics (SYNA +4.2%) is rallying thanks to an upgrade to Hold from Feltl & Co. In spite of being an iPhone 5 supplier, Synpatics closed yesterday near its 52-week low, thanks to worries about the impact of poor PC demand on touchpad sales, and touchscreen controller share loss with Android OEMs.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • MTP

    Dara BioSciences (DARA +3%) moves up after saying that Nasdaq notified the company that it has...

    Dara BioSciences (DARA +3%) moves up after saying that Nasdaq notified the company that it has regained compliance with Rule 5550(a)(2), which requires a minimum bid price of $1.00 for continued listing. The company added that a special meeting of stockholders that was scheduled on November 8 to consider a reverse stock split proposal to deal with the issue has been canceled as a result.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYNO

    Cynosure (CYNO -5%) dips this morning after filing late yesterday to sell 2.94M shares for holders.

    Cynosure (CYNO -5%) dips this morning after filing late yesterday to sell 2.94M shares for holders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • Z

    Zillow (Z -5.7%) plunges as an SEC letter dated Aug. 30 makes the rounds. The letter asks CEO...

    Zillow (Z -5.7%) plunges as an SEC letter dated Aug. 30 makes the rounds. The letter asks CEO Spencer Rascoff why Zillow doesn't provide data on the average price paid for subscriptions to its Premier Agent service; requests more clarity on Zillow's Marketplace revenue growth figures; and asks the company to provide more detail in its filings about accounting policy changes. (Citron Research report)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS +15.3%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP +15.1%) shoot higher after Bloomberg reports...

    MetroPCS (PCS +15.3%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP +15.1%) shoot higher after Bloomberg reports Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY), parent of T-Mobile USA, is close to a deal for MetroPCS, long the subject of M&A speculation. Sprint (S -6.9%) and Clearwire (CLWR -4.1%) are selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • KATE

    Fifth & Pacific (FNP -15.3%) slumps after the retailer slashes its outlook for full-year profits...

    Fifth & Pacific (FNP -15.3%) slumps after the retailer slashes its outlook for full-year profits with its Juicy Couture brand showing poor results. On the positive side, the company says direct-to-consumer comparable sales for Kate Spade and Lucky Brand rose 21% and 4%, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • DVN

    A more robust outlook for natural gas prices is lifting prospects for producers Devon Energy...

    A more robust outlook for natural gas prices is lifting prospects for producers Devon Energy (DVN +1.2%), Comstock Resources (CRK +0.8%) and Cimarex Energy (XEC +1.8%), FBR Capital says in upgrading shares to Outperform. "U.S. natural gas market fundamentals have already undergone substantial structural realignment needed to balance the market," FBR says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • PBM

    Pacific Booker Minerals (NYSEMKT:PBM) -70% at the open after the B.C. government rejects plans...

    Pacific Booker Minerals (NYSEMKT:PBM) -70% at the open after the B.C. government rejects plans for a copper and gold mine in the province’s northwest, saying the project could endanger salmon in the Skeena River. PBM had planned to dig out 30K metric tons of copper and gold ore from the site each day over 21 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD) +4.7% premarket after announcing the commercial launch of the...

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD) +4.7% premarket after announcing the commercial launch of the miRview mets assay, its flagship product, in the U.S. oncology market. miRview mets2 is a diagnostic tool for clinicians in the evaluation of cancer patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) +7.1% to $52.44 after the U.K.'s Times newspaper reports (paywall) that...

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) +7.1% to $52.44 after the U.K.'s Times newspaper reports (paywall) that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) may make another bid for the company at $60 a share. Illumina already rejected a Roche bid of $51 in April.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • JMBA

    Jamba Juice (NASDAQ:JMBA) shoots 10.1% higher premarket after Lloyd Khaner from Khaner Capital...

    Jamba Juice (NASDAQ:JMBA) shoots 10.1% higher premarket after Lloyd Khaner from Khaner Capital lines up the name as his new turnaround pick to soar. A low debt ratio and an adept CEO caught Khaner's eye, although he's a bit late to the party with shares already up 73% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN) -2.6% after delaying the filing of its 10-K - the Wi-Fi equipment...

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN) -2.6% after delaying the filing of its 10-K - the Wi-Fi equipment vendor says it needs more time to finish assessing its internal controls, due to IT-related deficiencies. The news is overshadowing Wells Fargo's decision to launch coverage with an Outperform and $25-$27 target range.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are pointing higher on a report that Spain is ready to ask for a...

    Market preview: Stock futures are pointing higher on a report that Spain is ready to ask for a bailout, although PM Mariano Rajoy plays down the speculation, while Germany is dragging its feet. S&P benchmark +0.5%. JPMorgan +0.3% despite facing fraud allegations over Bear Stearns' dodgy mortgage bonds. Express plummets 16.5% following an earnings warning. Ongoing/Later : Auto sales, ISM New York Business Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CTIC

    Premarket gainers: CTIC +23%. JMBA +11%. ILMN +6%. ROSG-OLD +6%.Losers: ARQL -61%. EXPR -16%....

    Premarket gainers: CTIC +23%. JMBA +11%. ILMN +6%. ROSG-OLD +6%.
    Losers: ARQL -61%. EXPR -16%. FNP -14%. LL -7%. GAIN -6%. SFL -6%. GEL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI): FQ4 EPS of $0.88 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $514.3M (+4% Y/Y) misses...

    Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI): FQ4 EPS of $0.88 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $514.3M (+4% Y/Y) misses by $8M. Shares -6.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • CBLI

    The FDA grants orphan-drug status to curaxin CBL0102, which is being developed by a Russian JV...

    The FDA grants orphan-drug status to curaxin CBL0102, which is being developed by a Russian JV of Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +6.5%) and Bioprocess Capital Ventures for treating hepatocellular carcinoma, a type of liver cancer. The disease affects around 30K people in the U.S. and 45K in the EU each year, and the survival rate is 15%. A Phase I trial of CBL0102 is being carried out in Russia. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) trades 6.4% lower premarket with the buzz that a negative research...

    Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) trades 6.4% lower premarket with the buzz that a negative research report from Off Wall Street is tipping sentiment. The equity research firm calls LL a $25 stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) jumps 21% after its Opaxio drug for treating malignant brain...

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) jumps 21% after its Opaxio drug for treating malignant brain cancer receives the FDA's orphan-drug status, which provides the developing company with marketing, fee and tax benefits. The agency assigns the status based on the early results of a Phase II study. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • ARQL

    ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) dives 64% premarket following the discontinuation of its Phase 3 MARQUEE...

    ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) dives 64% premarket following the discontinuation of its Phase 3 MARQUEE (c-Met inhibitor ARQ 197) trial. "We are disappointed that the MARQUEE trial did not provide statistically significant results." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • SFL

    Ship Finance International (NYSE:SFL) -5.6% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6M...

    Ship Finance International (NYSE:SFL) -5.6% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6M shares. SFL intends to use net proceeds to invest in new assets within the shipping and offshore sectors and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • EXPR

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) lowers its forecast for Q3, saying trends worsened abruptly in September....

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) lowers its forecast for Q3, saying trends worsened abruptly in September. The company now expects Q3 fiscal comparable sales to decline in the mid single digit range and EPS to land in a range of $0.16-$0.20, well below the consensus mark that analysts were calling for of $0.29. The retailer warns it had to increase promotional activity to maintain its inventory discipline. Shares -19.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • MOS

    More on Mosaic (NYSE:MOS): Lower phosphate sales (off 30%) and prices (off 8%) are behind an...

    More on Mosaic (NYSE:MOS): Lower phosphate sales (off 30%) and prices (off 8%) are behind an 18.4% Y/Y decline in earnings and 19.3% decline in revenues. Potash sales of 1.9M tons come in at the week end of expectations, thanks to soft demand in China and India. FQ2 guidance: Phosphate sales of 3-3.4M tons (vs. FQ1 of 2.7M) and potash sales of 1.6-1.9M tons (vs. FQ1 of 1.9M). Shares -1.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM

  • European shares open broadly lower on uncertainty about whether Spain will ask for a bailout -...

    European shares open broadly lower on uncertainty about whether Spain will ask for a bailout - although Madrid investors seem to be less concerned - while Moody's has yet to say whether it will cut the country's debt to junk status. An announcement had been expected yesterday. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.1%, London -0.3%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.1%, Milan flat, Madrid +0.2%. Spanish 10-year bond yields -7 bps to 5.82%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed following yesterday's decent U.S. manufacturing report for September,...

    Asian shares are mixed following yesterday's decent U.S. manufacturing report for September, while Australian shares gain following the RBA's surprise rate cut. Japan -0.1%, Sydney +1%. Hong Kong, China, India closed.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 AM
